data.text:
"We are scientific fighters. We are not fighting with bullets. Our arms are our knowledge."

-- After 2 years on the frontlines of the Ebola response, @WHO's @MR_Belizaire is now fighting #COVID19 in Central African Republic. Listen to her story: https://t.co/33pdrMKDWi https://t.co/OVVEX0MAJ5

Nuclear testing harms the environment, human health & economic development. It is a relic of another age and has no place in the 21st century. 

Saturday is the International Day against Nuclear Tests: https://t.co/5kO5e0Ffbc https://t.co/P92mzxrsD6

New @UNAIDS report reveals interruptions of HIV services, violence, harassment, abuse, arrests, deaths and a failure to respect human rights in  early responses to the #COVID19 pandemic around the world. 

#StandUp4HumanRights - always! https://t.co/gQWDfZPapm https://t.co/WEoUmR4Fwk

"Africa has been declared free of polio.

This historic milestone fills me with hope and optimism.

We can achieve so much when we work together as a global community."

-- @antonioguterres on the great health news this week. #VaccinesWork. https://t.co/8WnvmAdtoC

A complete ban on nuclear testing is an essential step in preventing the  improvement of nuclear weapons and in achieving nuclear disarmament.

-- @antonioguterres on Saturday's International Day against Nuclear Tests. https://t.co/7qKAnVut9u https://t.co/k7NGQS5QvG
On Saturday's International Day against Nuclear Tests, find out about the work of @ctbto_alerts for a nuclear test free world: https://t.co/PjZo23GpH1 https://t.co/eE831mdDES

Every day, in 13 operations around the world, 95,000 UN peacekeepers serve at great personal risk and under harsh conditions to:

✔️ Maintain and restore peace and security
✔️ Help and protect communities
✔️ Promote human rights

& much more. 

https://t.co/Z1mKcW36cl #UN75 https://t.co/F8OltWR0Cj

Masks help stop #COVID19 from spreading, but many families are wondering about the type of masks to get and how to introduce them to children. 

@UNICEF has tips and expert guidance to help protect you and those you love during the pandemic. https://t.co/3Ri4pHDteo

As governments mobilize trillions of dollars to recover from #COVID19, their decisions will have climate consequences for decades.

These choices can either propel #ClimateAction forward, or set us back years.

-- @antonioguterres https://t.co/fzFB4qX9ZE https://t.co/Yiiqmq3zUF

🛒 Delivering groceries
🍲 Cooking free meals
😷 Sewing masks
📝 Providing translations
🩺 Working as health care professionals

Refugees are supporting their host communities in many different ways amid #COVID19. via @Refugees 

https://t.co/x6NjlcQdpH

#VaccinesWork, are safe & help prevent millions of deaths every year. 

Anti-vaccine messages stir up fear & ignore the serious risks posed by preventable diseases like smallpox, measles & polio. 

https://t.co/9cNARG43wd https://t.co/1Rls5bxmAZ

"I am a big believer in the power of human stories to educate, engage & generate empathy."

In the new season of the Awake At Night podcast, @MelissaFleming talks to UN humanitarians about their motivations to continue their life-saving work amid #COVID19. https://t.co/4C9nNQrhor

Whatever you are doing to stop the spread of #COVID19 – keep it up. 
Preventing the further spread of #coronavirus is a shared responsibility for us all.  

🎨: Karina Muranaga https://t.co/mwdCJ0Glq5

New @UNHumanRights report calls for accountability & justice for human rights violations & abuses during the protests that took place between October 2019 and April 2020 in Iraq. #StandUp4HumanRights
https://t.co/8wlHdRydiY

.@UNYouthEnvoy invites young people who are at the forefront of creative #ClimateAction to an intergenerational virtual conversation with policy makers this Friday. 

Register here ➡️ https://t.co/W5uaKDp5Lv #31DaysOfYOUth https://t.co/AflBF6G3R1

At least one third of the world’s schoolchildren – 463 million children globally – were unable to access remote learning during #COVID19 school closures.

New @UNICEF report outlines limitations of remote learning and exposes deep inequalities in access.
https://t.co/66XTkUREpt

"Once this period passes, I hope we can be stronger, overcoming bigger issues & becoming a more resilient society.”

Sajjad and other frontline workers at the @UNDP-supported Al-Hussein Hospital share their hopes for Iraq after the #COVID19 crisis.

https://t.co/RxVaZkJGny

#COVID19 is changing our world, but with the right approach we can build back better & stronger.

Recycling, reusing, planting trees - there are many ways you can take #ClimateAction & do your part to make the world a better place. https://t.co/ObsefnV2ok https://t.co/QR7YmN49ge

110,000+ people have already expressed their support for: 

Peace
Human rights
Equality 
Dignity for all

Join them by adding your image to photo filters that promote UN values for our 75th birthday! 

https://t.co/Cquddc4W9p #UN75 https://t.co/bUfIFVLxys

Physical distancing does not have to mean social or emotional isolation. 

Connect with your loved ones. We are in this together -- and we”ll get through #COVID19 together.

🎨: Nubefy Design for All https://t.co/r09tozEw0s

Iraq: As #COVID19 is aggravating deep-rooted economic, social and political challenges, top UN official in the country calls on leaders to unite and put the nation’s interests first.

https://t.co/9arpLLk2Si

3 years after hundreds of thousands of Rohingya refugees fled from Myanmar to Bangladesh, challenges persist and continue to evolve, with #COVID19 adding additional complexities.

Watch to learn more & see how @Refugees is helping. https://t.co/txP18fxPw1 https://t.co/QjGJUiN8H4

"From mobile payments to crowdfunding, digital technology is already helping to meet development challenges."

-- @antonioguterres launches report outlining how digital finance can help achieve the #GlobalGoals and build back better after #COVID19. https://t.co/THWoQthOf2 https://t.co/kJCdRzR0Nq

🐕 Explosive detection dogs
🐶 Therapy dogs
🐕 Demining dogs

On Wednesday's #DogDay we want to thank all our K-9 colleagues & their handlers for their hard work around the world. https://t.co/eEsrjtbZ8r

🧴 Wash your hands frequently
🤭 Avoid touching your face
🤧 Cover your cough
👥👥 Avoid crowded places
🏠 Stay home if unwell

More tips from @WHO to protect yourself & others during #COVID19: https://t.co/w3s3KMGzbj

https://t.co/56eSr8q2lZ

The UN works for everyone, everywhere by taking #ClimateAction, feeding the hungry, responding to humanitarian crises & so much more. 

#GlobalGoals themed gifts help promote & support our work towards a better future for all. https://t.co/K0a8UakFIT https://t.co/rzNnUyCAno

Around the world, women are playing critical roles as first responders & leaders during #COVID19 and other crisis.

@un_women helps them tell their stories and gain more recognition for their humanitarian contributions. https://t.co/BS5P3G0hu1

It may not always make the headlines -- but the UN works all over the world to prevent conflict and keep peace & stability.

As the UN turns 75, see how else the Organization makes a difference in the lives of everyone, everywhere: https://t.co/uKqX2tYSiH #UN75 https://t.co/gBRAZh2P99

“I hope it will inspire leaders on all sides to re-engage constructively in meaningful negotiations to resolve the Israeli Palestinian conflict.”

-- @nmladenov tells UN Security Council about recent agreement between Israel and the United Arab Emirates.
https://t.co/jnhCGH8GyK

Misinformation is dangerous & can hamper our ability to make progress on global issues.

So, #TakeCareBeforeYouShare: Take a moment to pause and verify facts before posting online. https://t.co/9cNARG43wd https://t.co/bk7N86232E

Great news: Africa has been declared free of wild polio after 4 years without a case, showing that progress against some of the biggest global health challenges is possible.
https://t.co/8WnvmzVS02

3 years after hundreds of thousands of Rohingya refugees fled from Myanmar to Bangladesh, challenges persist and continue to evolve, with #COVID19 adding additional complexities.

@Refugees is calling for renewed support & lasting solutions. https://t.co/nIcODafsuy

"It is imperative that we rebuild tourism in a safe, equitable and climate friendly way."

-- @antonioguterres on the need to support the recovery of the tourism sector, following devastating losses due to #COVID19. https://t.co/QswSypzhe4 https://t.co/A1RPqWwFVd

In the aftermath of the #Beirut explosions, prices for staple foods in Lebanon are expected to rise, putting millions at risk of food insecurity.

@WFP is helping the most vulnerable families across the country. https://t.co/1tvNjJcolC https://t.co/e32Yxb4HSl

"We are scientific fighters. We are not fighting with bullets."

After 2 years on frontlines of the Ebola response, @WHO epidemiologist @MR_Belizaire is now fighting #COVID19 in Central African Republic.

Listen to her story in our Awake at Night podcast: https://t.co/TVZYuTQG0W https://t.co/qmVfMfABJ8
Bringing the #coronavirus pandemic under control through equitable, fair access to #COVID19 vaccines requires urgent commitment and investment from countries, says @WHO. https://t.co/oz9MkEeffM

“I am willing to treat patients, but I need to feel safe, too. Right now, prayer is the only protection I have." 

-- Health care heroes like nurse Irene Versoza continue their life-saving work in Yemen amid #COVID19 and despite a lack of medical supplies. https://t.co/tZQ6q1A9fS

Vaccines are key to a healthy future for every child.

@UNICEF & @WHO encourage families to ensure kids are up-to-date on their vaccinations, even during the #COVID19 pandemic. https://t.co/UUx1Hw4vsv #VaccinesWork https://t.co/67CS3b11E7

Misinformation is causing global harm, hampering our ability to make progress on many of the world’s most pressing issues.

So take time to verify facts before you share something online. https://t.co/9cNARGlEUN #TakeCareBeforeYouShare https://t.co/2qekKsycQz

About 40% of transmissions could be happening because of droplets of spit that you emit while talking.

-- @p_openshaw on importance of wearing face masks to help prevent the spread of #COVID19.

More from @WHO: https://t.co/doHQ5dLJ3J https://t.co/4wF1wYWVAM

Now — more than ever,
your voice matters,
your ideas matter.

Share your solutions for a better future, as the UN marks 75 years of working on behalf of people everywhere. https://t.co/xZylMfLi8z #UN75 https://t.co/j46LpvOCmU

Everyone has the right to a nationality.

Yet, millions around the world have been denied their right to a nationality, preventing them from going to school, seeing a doctor, getting a job or even getting married.

See how @Refugees is helping: https://t.co/ABRn5GFjuD https://t.co/yiaY6ucRgE

#VaccinesWork

Vaccines are safe & help prevent millions of deaths every year. Yet, a growing number of networks seek to undermine trust in vaccinations.

Help share verified information that saves lives: https://t.co/9cNARG43wd https://t.co/kLZB6nE4qv

With the #COVID19 pandemic placing so many of the world’s children in jeopardy, I appeal to leaders at all levels: protect our children and safeguard their well-being.

-- @antonioguterres on the impact of #coronavirus on children. https://t.co/zjS0W8q2xq https://t.co/fT7YOjBYJ6
On Sunday's #RememberSlavery Day, we pay homage to all who fought the injustice of the slave trade. https://t.co/ETh08YvRu7 https://t.co/CE9rEKkqj1

Agriculture contributes about 1/5 of greenhouse gas emissions & is a primary cause of biodiversity loss.

See how @UNDP works to tackle the climate emergency & achieve #ZeroHunger by implementing more sustainable agricultural systems. https://t.co/rQUe2cb1rw
On Sunday's #RememberSlavery Day, find out more about the International Decade of People of #AfricanDescent: https://t.co/SyNBqTcw93 https://t.co/1J1GB9A6Oe

📷: The "Ark of Return" at UNHQ honours the victims of slavery & highlights the legacy of the slave trade. 

More about the permanent memorial on Sunday's #RememberSlavery Day: https://t.co/1FfazIcKxz https://t.co/r5IDwNVJGz

"How the world recovers from #COVID19 is a make-or-break moment for the health of our planet."

-- @antonioguterres stresses potential of #coronavirus response to do things right for the future.
https://t.co/Y29uCFjX0U

The worldwide response to #COVID19 has demonstrated the power of solidarity. People are spreading kindness through their words & deeds -- while inspiring others to do the same.

No act of goodwill is too small in the fight against #coronavirus.

🎨: Nat Bullard https://t.co/aGYFcFItPR

Sporting associations should respect & protect the human rights of all athletes, regardless of their sex characteristics.

UN @free_equal is calling for greater gender equality in sports. 

More on their work to #StandUp4HumanRights. https://t.co/kVEDh8noLI https://t.co/XTqEvJ4XAh

As of Saturday, the world has already used up more resources than can be renewed in 2020. 

All of us need to #ActNow to ensure sustainable consumption & production to protect our planet. https://t.co/099WaGYyWL #EarthOverShootDay https://t.co/FBaHKobSEw

"The right to freedom of religion or belief is firmly trenched in international human rights law & is a cornerstone for inclusive, prosperous & peaceful societies."

-- @antonioguterres on the Int'l Day for Victims of Violence Based on Religion or Belief. https://t.co/iNFjiJN1Ax https://t.co/Juywv0RbAA

.@WHO's @MR_Belizaire was on frontlines of Ebola. Now she helps implement #COVID19 response strategies for the most vulnerable in the Central African Republic.

🎧 Listen to her story in the new episode of the Awake at Night podcast with @MelissaFleming: https://t.co/33pdrMKDWi https://t.co/tTHgFgJYFA

The devastating oil spill off the coast of Mauritius highlights the need for global regulations that protect small island countries and their vulnerable marine ecosystems, says @UNCTAD. https://t.co/i4qDwENYnv

Amid #COVID19, social workers, counselors & helpline workers are a lifeline for countless vulnerable children. 

@UNICEF supports these frontline workers as they continue their job of keeping children safe and engaged. https://t.co/lNPp3gNc4i https://t.co/vjrLSegSwC

It's easy to share misinformation when you're distracted.

Pause & take your time to make sure you are sharing accurate & factual information. #TakeCareBeforeYouShare

https://t.co/9cNARGlEUN https://t.co/CaSnkL6ewW

"We owe it to every victim and survivor of terrorism to protect and promote their human rights, amplify their voices and uphold their dignity."

-- @UN_OCT chief Vladimir Voronkov on Friday's #VictimsOfTerrorism Day. 
More from @_UNChronicle: https://t.co/CyR7A3ykOu https://t.co/s9ETKocwhv

School closures in Africa are significantly impacting children - some face malnutrition, exposure to violence & mental health challenges.

@WHO & @UNICEF have guidelines on the safe reopening of schools to limit the spread of #COVID19 & protect children. https://t.co/DzzZadzvqD https://t.co/jZOncdWt4B

"The United Nations stands in solidarity with all victims of terrorism -- today and every day."

-- @antonioguterres on Friday's #VictimsOfTerrorism Day. https://t.co/f5ViX7voDA https://t.co/I6su5giPjd

As Somalia faces major challenges posed by #COVID19, insecurity, seasonal floods and desert locusts, UN officials in the country urge leaders to break the election impasse & engage in dialogue in the national interest.

https://t.co/yBZYrLgfMf

Remembering the victims of terrorism is a vital part of the healing process. Yet, #COVID19 has made grieving even more difficult.

More on Friday's #VictimsOfTerrorism Day: https://t.co/f5ViX7dNM2 https://t.co/GDNN3L0kMO

Around the world, people are lifting each other up and showing solidarity amid the #COVID19 pandemic and other challenges.

Check out these inspiring examples of unity. https://t.co/GIv7loW0XD

About 40% of transmissions could be happening because of droplets of spit that you emit while talking.

-- @p_openshaw on the importance of wearing face masks to help prevent the spread of #COVID19. 

More from @WHO: https://t.co/doHQ5du8cb https://t.co/IEZb9frAuE

"No society is immune from atrocity crimes."

As he leaves his post as head of @UN_GP_RtoP, Adama Dieng reflects on the need to strengthen the rule of law, fight impunity and prevent genocides. https://t.co/UBUyqspWWu

With the help of @UNEP, some of the biggest names in mobile gaming are using their video games to raise awareness about the urgent need for #ClimateAction to their 250-million users worldwide.
https://t.co/COpMSGRfWd

Civilians have increasingly become the victims of armed conflict. Protecting them is a priority for @UNPeacekeeping missions around the world. 

See how brave women & men are #ServingForPeace in some of the most challenging environments: https://t.co/rleeL45Jdv https://t.co/UwejVaOSby

"This is a momentous task - to establish a foundational act, a social contract for Syrians - after a decade of conflict and amid deep divisions and mistrust."

-- @UNEnvoySyria tells Security Council ahead of next week's constitutional reform talks. https://t.co/FuE1eqqGO2

"The people of #Lebanon and the refugees they have hosted for decades need strong international help at this time of suffering, crisis and uncertainty."

-- @Refugees chief @FilippoGrandi is in #Beirut to support people affected by the explosions. 

https://t.co/JogBY8sF86 https://t.co/LPTU1IM8BG

Mali: @antonioguterres strongly condemned the military mutiny and calls for constitutional order and the rule of law to be immediately restored. 
https://t.co/2GUlKjYHxZ
On Wednesday's #WorldHumanitarianDay, see how the UN family celebrated #RealLifeHeroes helping to make our world a better place. https://t.co/lAtEBbw1cH

On Wednesday's #WorldHumanitarianDay we remember our 22 colleagues who lost their lives when the UN in Baghdad was bombed in 2003.

Today, and every day, we thank the brave humanitarians who risk their lives to make the world a better place. https://t.co/zp0iH3Zppb https://t.co/USjnkAxXqo

"We are scientific fighters. We are not fighting with bullets. Our arms are our knowledge."

-- After 2 years on the frontlines of the Ebola response, @WHO epidemiologist @MR_Belizaire is now fighting #COVID19 in the Central African Republic. https://t.co/cztvaZupUe

Amid the #COVID19 pandemic, humanitarians are:

🍚 Distributing food to people in need
👩‍👧Providing safe spaces for women & girls
🩺Providing services in refugee camps & much more.

They are #RealLifeHeroes. https://t.co/yrBWA2NE3C 
#WorldHumanitarianDay https://t.co/a35tCRv2k6

Simple steps can make a big difference for protecting our water resources:
🚿 Take shorter showers
🥦 Eat more plant-based meals
🛒 Shop sustainably

@UN_Water has more tips on how to #ActNow: https://t.co/rX1YiWOaKS #GlobalGoals https://t.co/5JMMfh7sYP

Around the world, @UNVolunteers are on the frontlines of the fight against #COVID19.

On #WorldHumanitarianDay, we thank these real life heroes who dedicate their lives to helping others. https://t.co/Hyx3fWk9w2 https://t.co/Qx8rjSfiIz

#COVID19 has sparked a worrying rise in misinformation & conspiracy theories.

@UNESCO shares tips for identifying them. https://t.co/GIVk2cyWl7 https://t.co/IOltRjBjH3

This year, humanitarian workers are stretched like never before.

They are the unsung heroes of the pandemic response – and they all too often risk their own lives to save the lives of others.

-- @antonioguterres on Wednesday's #WorldHumanitarianDay. https://t.co/683lJ6xpV4 https://t.co/5TjZGlZ93X

"We need to prevent #COVID19 vaccine nationalism."

-- @WHO chief @DrTedros stresses the importance of solidarity among countries to provide a joint solution to the #coronavirus crisis and to guarantee fair access for all. https://t.co/jP7LtGEHdF https://t.co/lXejzqies2

Every day, brave people around the world are stepping up to help others & save lives despite multiple challenges and threats, including #COVID19.

On Wednesday's #WorldHumanitarianDay, we pay tribute to those real life heroes. https://t.co/0kFVmE1vkn via @UNOCHA https://t.co/ikLuheVcYI

#COVID19 highlights the risk wildlife crime poses to human health, economies & biodiversity.

@UNDP is working with partners to target key shipping ports to detect & intercept illegal wildlife products. https://t.co/B7G2FemBWY https://t.co/EA1TDoanDn

Humanity
Neutrality
Impartiality
Independence

4 humanitarian principles for Wednesday's #WorldHumanitarianDay & every day. https://t.co/0kFVmE1vkn https://t.co/8CkoHjK889

The effects of the climate crisis devastated the ancestral lake of the Uru-Murato people in Bolivia, then the threat of #COVID19 made their lives even more difficult. 

@WFP is helping the indigenous community survive despite the odds. https://t.co/Q0ZPTvmdB2

Everyone has the right to life, liberty and security of person.

Here’s how @refugees is working to #StandUp4HumanRights and protect the most vulnerable people during #COVID19. https://t.co/2yeuVh395I https://t.co/MAFWhQCTCT

Physical distancing will help the world contain #COVID19 -- but it also isolates women & girls from the support of family & friends when they experience violence at home. 

@UN_Women is raising awareness about this #ShadowPandemic. https://t.co/RfPrxMpsCB https://t.co/p7qrLVYw4t

Sonia Almassad is one of the brave humanitarians working with @UNOCHA in Yemen. She's helping to provide aid to people trapped in one of the world's worst humanitarian disasters. 

Read this real life hero's story ahead of #WorldHumanitarianDay: https://t.co/5WVr4vBVt0

People with disabilities are among the most vulnerable groups in a health crisis like #COVID19. 

Inclusion, participation & access to technology are critical in response and recovery efforts. More: https://t.co/OzebyZjS3w https://t.co/Hhpr82vWun

Amid #COVID19, social workers, counsellors & helpline workers are a lifeline for countless vulnerable children. 

@UNICEF supports these frontline workers as they continue their job of keeping children safe and engaged. https://t.co/lNPp3gNc4i https://t.co/Rv4idBYWvH

After decades of steady decline, the number of people who suffer from hunger began to slowly increase again in 2015.

The UN works to provide food and assistance to 86.7 million people in 83 countries. https://t.co/Z1mKcVLuNL #UN75 #ZeroHunger https://t.co/YRjqJAtMBm

The #COVID19 pandemic is an economic, humanitarian, security & human rights crisis. 

See how the UN is fighting #coronavirus to save lives, protect societies & help communities recover better. https://t.co/u8vZwDq0Zq https://t.co/9Hctm83A6H

Misinformation is causing global harm, hampering our ability to make progress on many of the world’s most pressing issues.

So pause & take time to verify facts before you share something online. https://t.co/9cNARG43wd #TakeCareBeforeYouShare https://t.co/AxQdPaD1vP

800+ youth volunteers in Zambia went door-to-door to 700,000 households, helping to dispel myths & providing up-to-date information on #COVID19.

@UNVolunteers has more on how young people are stepping up to keep people safe during the pandemic. https://t.co/PB90ft6z6z https://t.co/Z0UpG955to

Tackling global challenges requires everyone's participation. 
#COVID19 knows no boundaries & neither should our efforts to respond to the crisis and build back better.  

We need strong global partnerships & cooperation now more than ever. https://t.co/vlQeqK4Tu1 #GlobalGoals https://t.co/T31Ch4MCnk

During these times of high-stress & uncertainty amid #COVID19, it's important to look after your mental health.

🏃‍♀️🥗 Stay active & eat well
📲 Stay in contact with friends & family 
🤗 Be kind to yourself & others

More tips from @voicesofyouth: https://t.co/tYgQYEQnrD https://t.co/YzbANwOo87

In the latest episode of our Awake At Night podcast, you get to meet @ZainabHawa, who shares with @MelissaFleming the pain she felt hearing countless accounts of rape inflicted on women & girls as a weapon of war: https://t.co/T3cMhgeeRD https://t.co/jy50809tXK
